div.p: BEING THE SUBSTANCE OF TWO SERMONS, PREACHED AT NEWBURY, LORD's DAY, SEPTEMBER 10th, 1780.
By PETER POWERS, A. M. PASTOR OF THE CHURCH IN SAID NEWBURY AND HAVERHILL.
WESTMINSTER: PRINTED BY SPOONER & GREEN. 1781.

div.head: Tyranny and Toryiſm expoſed.

epigraph.q: So ſhall he do, he ſhall even return, and have Intelligence with them that forſake the holy Covenant.—And ſuch as do wickedly againſt the Covenant, ſhall be corrupt by Flatteries.

div.p:
THE cruel Tyrant here intended was ANTIOCHUS EPIPHANES, the little Horn in Daniel's Viſion, Chap. VIII. 9,—12. And out of one of them came forth a little Horn, which waxed exceeding great toward the South, and toward the Eaſt, and toward the pleaſant Land. And it waxed great even to the Hoſt of Heaven; and it caſt down ſome of the Hoſt, and of the Stars to the Ground, and ſtamped upon them. Yea he magnified himſelf even to the Prince of the Hoſt, and by him the daily Sacrifice was taken away, and the Place of his Sanctuary was caſt down. And an Hoſt was given him againſt the daily Sacrifice, by Reaſon of Tranſgreſſion; and it caſt down the Truth to the Ground, and it practiſed and proſpered. This is explained to the Prophet by the Angel, That in the latter Time of their Kingdom, when the Tranſgreſſors are come to the full, a King of fierce Countenance, and Underſtanding dark Sentences, ſhall ſtand up. And his Power ſhall be mighty, but not by his own Power; and he ſhall deſtroy wonderfully, and ſhall proſper and practiſe, and ſhall deſtroy the mighty, and the holy People. And through his Policy alſo he ſhall cauſe Craft to proſper in his Hand, and he ſhall magnify himſelf on his Heart, and by Peace ſhall deſtroy many: He ſhall alſo ſtand up againſt the Prince of Princes; but he ſhall be broken without Hand.
Ver. 23, 24, 25.

OUR Text ſays, He ſhall return, meaning to Paleſtine, where he had been, before, engaged in his bloody Wars and Maſſacres, and ſhall have intelligence with them that forſake the holy Covenant. The Apoſtates and vile Mercenaries among the Jews, called the Tranſgreſſors,
Chap. 8. 23. ſhould give him Intelligence of every Deſign of the Jews, and who were in Oppoſition againſt him, what their Situation, Power and Strength; ſo that nothing could paſs in Judas Maccabeus's Camp or Councils, but it was carried him by theſe corrupt and abandoned Men, bribed and flattered out of all their Liberties, and their Religion. Theſe Miſcreants of the
Tyrant forſook the holy Covenant, the Covenant of the LORD GOD of their Fathers, and the Covenant they themſelves had made to ſerve the Lord, to keep his Laws, and maintain the Rights and Privileges of that People. They were ſuch as did-wickedly againſt the Covenant, whom this Monſter corrupted by Flatteries. Traitors, and the worſt of Traitors were they againſt God and againſt his People, their own People, for the Sake of filthy Lucre: The Love of Money was to them the Root of all Evil. And no ſort of low Cunning, no Arts of Deceit and Falſhood were too much for them who had given themſelves over to Satan, and this great Officer of his curſed State and Kingdom.

BUT we are to obſerve, that the Foundation of all their Wickedneſs was, their forſaking the holy Covenant. And this is the Occaſion and Ground of all abominable Practices in a Chriſtian Land. Forſake the holy Covenant, then Lies and Fraud, and all the Arts of Injuſtice and Cruelty follow of Courſe—Nothing is too bad for ſuch a Man.

Now theſe corrupted Em • ſſaries of the Tyrant were among the Jews, what the Tories are in this Country in the preſent Day. They forſook the holy Covenant, and then they were corrupted by Flatteries to give Intelligence to one of the worſt of Men, and crueleſt of Tyrants that ever exiſted on this Side the infernal Regions. And how are ſuch Covenant-breakers corrupted ſtill by Bribes and Flatteries, to give the Tyrant and his Cut-throats Intelligence?
WE ſhall endeavor to take a little larger View of our Subject, under the following Propoſitions, viz.
I. DESCRIBE, in a comparative View, the Perſons ſpoken of in the Text.
II. WE ſhall endeavor to point out their heinous Wickedneſs.
III. SHEW the Danger of ſuch People in a State or Country.
IV. MAKE Application.
I. WE are to deſcribe, in a comparative View, the Perſons ſpoken of in the Text.

1. THE firſt is a Tyrant, and he one of the greateſt and worſt that ever exiſted among thoſe that had the Name of Man. Antiochus, it would ſeem, aimed to be more than a Nebuchadnezzar and Alexander both. He was worſe by far than both of them, for he even abandoned all Religion and Virtue. Not only did he level his Oppoſition againſt the Religion of the Jews, the only true Religion then in the World, but even the Religion of Nature, all the Religion of the Gentiles, ſee Ver. 36, 37, of the Context. And the King ſhall do according to his Will; and he ſhall exalt himſelf, and magnify himſelf above every
God; and he ſhall ſpeak marvellous Things againſt the God of Gods.—Neither ſhall he regard the God of his Fathers, nor the Deſire of Women, nor regard any God; for he ſhall magnify himſelf above all. So he was a perfect and conſummate Athirſt. This was uncommon. Nebuchadnezzar was a Deiſt, and a Worſhipper of Idols. Yea he owned and acknowleged the only true God. Dan. 3 28, 29. and 4. 2, 3, 37. And ſo did moſt, if not all the old Tyrants. The leſs any Man has of Religion, the more he is of a Tyrant. Moreover this Antiochus ſtripped and plundered a great Part of the World of their natural Rights and Privileges, took away their Eſtates and Laws, and ſuch as eſcaped with their Lives were turned into a State of Poverty and Diſtreſs. v. 43 He ſhall have Power over the Treaſures of Gold and of Silver; and over all the precious Things of Egypt. And he plundered the Temple and the City of Jeruſalem.1 Maccabees, 1 Chap.

FURTHERMORE, he uſed Chicanery and Flattery, corrupting and bribing People to favor and aſſiſt him in his wicked Practices. Thus this vile Perſon obtained the Kingdom by Flattery, ver. 21. And he corrupted by Flatteries looſe and wicked People to ſtand on his Side, and carry on his infernal Works of Rapine and Cruelty. What a lively Picture of later Tyrants. He ſcattered among them the Prey and the Spoil and the Riches, juſt as GEORGE the Third of England has among his corrupt Miniſtry, and his Vaſſals that he has flattered and cajoled to cut the Throats of this peaceable Country. How has he exhauſted the public Treaſury, and oppreſſed his loyal Subjects by moſt enormous Taxes, till they are in a great Meaſure ruined and bankrupted, and the poor periſhing in the Streets, ſtill hardened againſt all their Cries, Prayers, Petitions and Remonſtrances, and perfectly callous to all Feeling of the Miſeries of his People, till the Nation, being thrown into the greateſt Ferment, has riſen againſt him and his corrupt Parliament.

AGAIN, this impious Antiochus ſent Fire and Sword amongſt his Jewiſh Subjects, ver. 33. Yet they ſhall fall by the Sword, and by Flame, by Captivity and by Spoil many Days. This is exactly anſwered in his Antitype in England, who for theſe five or ſix Years has been laying many of our populous Towns in Aſhes, and pouring out the Blood of hundreds and thouſands of the peaceable Inhabitants by the Force of the Sword.

ONCE more, Antiochus was a great Perſecutor of the Saints of the moſt High. His Heart was againſt the holy Covenant, ver. 28. And thoſe whom he deſtroyed by the Sword, Fire, Captivity and Spoil▪ many days, were ſuch as had Underſtanding, and inſtructed many in the
Things of God, ver. 33. He deſtroyed the mighty and the holy People, and ſtood up againſt the Prince of Princes. Chap 8 24 25 He changed their Laws, took away their Religion, and placed the Abomination of Deſolation in the holy Place, ver. 31. See a particular amount of theſe things. I Mac. I. 44—63.

SIMILAR to this has the Tyrant of England begun his Perſecutions in this Land, by his notorious Quebec Bill, by which he eſtabliſhed Popery in the extended Province of Canada; and alſo by eſtabliſhing the Popiſh Religion in England laſt Year by Act of Parliament.

2. THE other Sort of People ſpoken of in our Text, is the Tyrant's Minions and Vaſſals; his corrupt Party. No Man ſo vile and wicked but he will have Companions, both in this World and in the World to come.—Now theſe were,
1. SUCH as forſook the holy Covenant.

THIS was the Covenant God made with his People Iſrael. The Covenant of Abraham, Iſaac, and Jacob. It alſo included the Sinai Covenant, which was founded on the Abrahamic. In this Covenant God promiſed to be their God, and took them to be his People.
〈◊〉 17. 8.Exod 20. 2 29 45. Deut. 29. 10,—13Deut. 7. 6. Alſo in this Covenant, he gave them Statutes, Laws and Inſtitutions for them to walk in. And he commanded them to be ſeparate from all People in the World, not to ſymbolize with them in Religion, Cuſtoms, and Manners, for they were a holy People to himſelf. But theſe wicked Perſons could not endure the Strictneſs and Severity of the divine Rules that were given them. Their Religion was too pure and holy for their unſanctified Hearts; and their blind and carnal Reaſon falſely taught them that there was no Neceſſity of it; and therefore, though they had joined in the holy Covenant Profeſſion of Religion, they ſoon forſook it. Perhaps not all at once, but by Degrees they grew worſe and worſe, till they wholly abandoned the Profeſſion as well as Practice of Religion. And how is this like Multitudes of the preſent Generation, who have forſaken the holy Covenant, and the Purity of Doctrine and Worſhip maintained by their Fathers? And from this have proceeded to more Ungodlineſs and Licentiouſneſs.

2. THESE People not only forſook, but did wickedly againſt the Covenant.—They broke the Covenant, and walked in direct Oppoſition to the holy Commands and I • ſti • u •• ons of it. They profaned the holy Covenant, and gave themſelves up to all vicious Pract •• es. And thus many, if not all, who have joined the Tyra • t of England, have gone into looſe Practices. They are generally a lying, diſhoneſt Sett of Creatures,
who▪ to the great Grief of good Men, have formerly been waiting for, and catching at Offices of Profit, P • aces and Penſions, to gratify their Pride and Avarice, and to ſupport their Extravagancies; and the lower Sort of them are abandoned to Idleneſs, Drunkenneſs and Deceit. And how very contrary is Religion and Virtue to ſuch Children of 〈◊〉 ? Thus they have done wickedly againſt the Covenant of the Lord God of their Fathers.

3. THESE wicked People were bribed and hired, and ſo gained to the Tyrant's Intereſt by Corruption.—Here we ſee where breaking and forſaking the holy Covenant will carry Men, even to all Wickedneſs: Now they are ready to do any Thing for Money; and are noſed about by Flatteries to commit Murders, and every vile Thing. Thus our Engliſh Antiochus has corrupted many of our Covenant-breakers, by Flatteries and a little filthy Lucre, to aid and aſſiſt him in all his Barbarities.

4. THESE People were the Tyrant's Spies, that gave him Intelligence. This was one of the moſt conſummate Pieces of their helliſh Wickedneſs and Hypocriſy. Theſe Covenant-breakers, that lived among the Jews, ſecretly informed Antiochus of all that paſſed, ſo that he knew how every Thing was going on in the Camp of the Maccabees, and the Situation they were in, whereby he was able to do according to his Will in many Reſpects. Our Tories, that live among us and in the Country, are not the firſt in ſuch an infernal Plan, who privately keep up their Correſpondence with the Enemy, and give them Intelligence of every Thing that may be to their Advantage. The old Spirit of Perſecution, and the Spirits of Devils reign in ſuch People, and they are of the malignant Spirit of their Father the Devil, ſecretly working, watching, and giving Information. For what? To aſſiſt the Nero of England to butcher and deſtroy peaceable Inhabitants, Men, Women and Children; who has hired his ſwarthy Barbarians to commit their ſavage Murders on the innocent and defenceleſs without Diſtinction. Witneſs Suſquehannah, and the Settlements above Albany.

WICKED Tyrants, to compaſs the Rights of Mankind, to deſtroy the righteous, and put an End to all who oppoſed their ambitious and haughty Deſigns, have ever had their cajoled and corrupted Minions, whom they have employed in watching and ſpying out good and honeſt People. So Saul had his Creatures to watch David; and Doeg was one of his Informers againſt him and the Prieſts of the Lord. The Phariſees watched our Saviour, and had their Spies, the Herodians, to watch and entangle him in his Talk. And how many have there been
ſent out by the bloody Nero of England, to watch every Part of our Country and our Army, to give him Intelligence? And, how ſhocking and ſurpriſing is it to think that ſuch Children of the infernal Regions, whoſe League is with Death and Hell, ſhould be ſupported by our own Inhabitants, to bring the Enemy upon the defenceleſs, to commit their Ravages and Depopulations on the frontier Settlements, without any juſt Provocation! My Soul, come not thou into their Secret: unto their Aſſembly, mine Honor, be not thou united.
WE proceed,
II. To ſhew the Heinouſneſs of the Wickedneſs of ſuch People.

AND, I. Breaking and forſaking the holy Covenant, is the Sin which ſtands in the Front of all, as big with the moſt heaven-daring Inſolence and Contempt of what is ſacred, and pregnant with every other Enormity.

GOD's Covenant is a holy Covenant: And where the Goſpel comes, People have it, in all the rich Grace of it, brought and freely tendered to them. Many think they are not in that Covenant except they are converted, or have made a public and ſolemn Recognition of it. Such People do but deceive themſelves. It is true indeed, that the unconverted have not embraced the Mercy and Grace of the Covenant, and ſo are not intereſted in the internal and ſpecial Bleſſings of it. And ſuch as have not publicly recognized the Covenant, are not under perſonal Bonds of their own, to the Church, to attend the Seals of it. But they are under the Law of the Covenant to their Maker; becauſe his Authority binds them in the ſtrongeſt Manner to be to him a People. The Children of Iſrael were in the Covenant, though they did not particularly and explicitly recognize it in but few Generations: and God conſidered them as his Covenant People. So now, my Brethren, you were born under the Covenant, and have it adminiſtred to you in a preached Goſpel. And you that do not heartily embrace it, do wickedly againſt it in that, and in your ſlighting the Grace and Mercy of it, and in turning your Backs upon the Seals of it. You do wickedly againſt it in all your ſinful Words and Actions, and in all your Oppoſition to God and Conformity to this World. And this is what aggravates your Sin, that it is againſt all the Mercy and Grace of the Covenant Had you never known the holy Covenant, your Wickedneſs had not been to 〈◊〉 us. And thus our 〈◊〉 Saviour ſays concerning the Jews, If I had not come and ſpoken to them they had not bad Sin; but new they have no Cloak for their Sin.—If I had not done among them the Works which none other man did, they had not had Sin.
John 15. 22, 24. To ſin againſt
the Love and Grace of the Redeemer, and all the rich Mercy of God in the new Covenant, is inconceivably heinous. But this our Infidels do, and this all our wicked People do▪ It is the very Caſe of our Drunkards, Swearers and Sabbath-breakers, with our unclean Perſons, and all our unjuſt and extortionous People. And is it not, in a glaring Light, moſt aggravatedly the Caſe with our Tories? The Tories in the Time of the Maccabees were the Tranſgreſſors who forſook the holy Covenant, and gave Intelligence to the Tyrant, being corrupted by Flatteries. Our Tories have forſaken the Covenant, and given the Antiochus of England ſecret Intelligence. They are corrupted with Flatteries, the Flatteries of an arbitrary and blood-thirſty Tyrant, with Flatteries to betray their own Country, the Lives, Liberties and Fortunes of their Neighbours, into the Hands of the hardned Pharaoh of England. And if this is not Wickedneſs, then Wickedneſs is not to be found in Earth or Hell. Wickedneſs is merely ideal, and nothing but a Whim and Chimera of vapoury Brains and dreaming Fools.

BREAKING and forſaking the Covenant of the Lord God of their Fathers, was the Sin which ruined Iſrael of old, by bringing all their fearful Judgments upon them, ſo as to make them an Aſtoniſhment and an H ••• ing among all the Nations. Deut. 29. 24, 25. Every Degree of Covenant-breaking is provoking to God, and will ſurely bring Wrath temporal as well as eternal without Repentance. How much more when Men go on to this high Degree of Wickedneſs, of betraying and ſelling their Country into the Hands of the Banditti of England, as Judas did his Maſter into the Hands of Murderers?

2. THE great Wickedneſs of Tyrants and their Mercenaries is, that they are guilty of Murder. And their Emiſſaries are the Cauſes of the cruelleſt of Murders. The Murders that have been committed in this Country, ſince the Boſton Maſſacre, are very numerous, and would ſwell into large Volumes, were they to be properly noted; and chiefly, if not altogether owing to theſe abandoned Wretches, the Tories, whoſe inveterate Malice, and inſatiate Avarice has kept them in perpetual Motion.

MURDER is a crying Sin. Innocent Blood cries, it cries for Vengeance. The Voice of thy Brother's Blood crieth to me from the Ground; and now thou art curſed. Gen. 4. 10, 11. O dreadful Thought! The Blood of Thouſands of poor Women and Children, and of Men proſtrate and begging for Mercy, cries for Vengeance on a guilty Tyrant, his murderous Army, and his apoſtate Kingdom, old in Blood, the Blood of God's Saints ſhed ſince the Reformation, ſince the Kingdom became a Proteſtant
Kingdom. But O, how it cries againſt thoſe of this Land who have forſaken and done wickedly againſt the holy Covenant▪ thoſe Miſcreants who have been l •• king about and ſecretly conveying Intelligence to the Enemy! And O, how has AMERICA, dear AMERICA, nurſed up Swarms of ſuch Vipers to ſuck her own Blood, the Blood of her Sons and Daughters! And are theſe murderers ſtill foſtered in our Boſoms? Are they yet indulged to go on in all their clandeſtine Frau • s, while they put on the ſanctimonious Air of Neighbour, Friend and Brother? But like David's ſecret Enemy, He hath put forth his Hand againſt ſuch as be at Peace with him; he hath broken his Covenant. The Words of his Mouth were ſmoother than Butter, but War was in his Heart; his Words were ſofter than Oil, yet were they drawn Swords. Pſal 55. •• , •• . Hypocriſy, cu •• ed Hypocriſy! Old Satan's Trade of Deceit when he ruined Mankind, and by which he ſtill draws Men to Perdition! Is not this Wickedneſs? ſecretly to murder the innocent, and bring Murderers unexpectedly upon a People, and deluge Towns and Cities in Blood, and lay them waſte with Fire and Sword?

Is there Honor and Generoſity in an Enemy? It has been boaſted among Britons, who profeſſed to act upon Principle—now no more! No Honor! no Virtue!—All, all the Serpent, Satan • ull of Rage, Envy and Malice, the Fires of Hell. And are any of America's Sons joined in the infernal Plan? Any that live in Peace among us, and enjoy the Privileges of free Citizens, engaged, by any Mea • s, to aid the hoſtile Foe? More than probable. But what is the Deſign? To ſupport Tyranny, and maintain the Devil's Cauſe by Fire and Sword. To pour out the Blood of Men, Women and Children promiſcuouſly. Perhaps they expect a Name in the Tyrant's Roll, or a Penſion by which they may poſſeſs the Eſtates of their murdered Neighbours, not fearing their frightful Ghoſts will haunt their H • uſes, and terrify their guilty Conferences. Hardned Wretches! They put far off the evil Day, that dreadful Day when their Hands will be found • u • l of Blood.

3. THESE Perſons are guilty of Falſhood, Lying and Perjury. Many of them have taken the Oa • h of Allegiance and Fidelity to their Country, yet are corrupted by Flatteries to give I • te •• ig • nce to the Enemy. And although they may tell Truth • n many of their Reports, yet it is with no better Deſign than the Devil's when he ſaid Skin for Skin, yea al • that 〈◊〉 him hath will he give for his Life.
• Jo •
• . 4. They have no good Deſign ••• what 〈◊〉 they convey to the Enemy. And 〈◊〉 have they decei •• d the Enemy, themſelves? 〈◊〉 their Neighbours to whom they have appeared as good Whigs.

THESE corrupted Vaſſals have loſt the Truth, have ſold it for the Support of Tyranny, and every Rule and Meaſure of Injuſtice. They are not afraid to ſpeak falſely like Doeg. Pſal, 52. 2, 3, 4. Thy Tongue deviſeth Miſchief, like a ſharp Raizer working deceitfully. Thou loveſt Evil more than Good, and lying rather than to ſpeak Righteouſneſs: Selah. Thou loveſt all devouring Words, O thou deceitful Tongue. This, this is the Trade of Tories, to lye and deceive. And is it not a heinous Sin? And what will be the Conſequence? What ſhall be given unto thee—thou falſe Tongue?—Sharp Arrows of the Mighty, with Coals of Juniper.
Pſal. 120. 3. 4. And all Liers ſhall have their Part in the Lake which burneth with Fire and Brimſtone.
Rev. 21. 8▪ Every one ſhould tremble at a Lye. It is ſo exceedingly contrary to the God of Truth, that he will puniſh it. Truth is ſacred, moſt ſacred and dear; but all Falſhood is helliſh and deteſtable.

BUT when ſhall we end?—There is a Complication of all Wickedneſs in theſe abandoned Creatures. The holy Covenant broken, Religion given up; for although they may ſometimes attend a few external Duties, it can be no better than the wicked Woman's in the Proverbs, I have Peace-Offerings with me: this Day have I paid my Vows.
Prov. •
•• . It is all with a moſt pernicious Deſign, even for a Covert of their wickedneſs, that they may not be ſo readily ſuſpected. They hate the Truth, they love Falſhood and Lying, chuſe and delight in the wicked, and revel and ſport with the Lives and Liberties of Mankind. They court eternal Damnation, which will ſoon be their Portion, when the crying Blood of the poor Innocents will have an Hearing, except timely Repentance prevents.
WE proceed,
III. To ſhew the Danger of ſuch Perſons in a State or Country.
AND beſure ſuch People are ſome of the greateſt Peſts to Mankind, though careſſed and applauded by the Tyrants.—For,
1. THEY are a Part of the Community, a Part of it's Numbers and Strength; and therefore they take off ſo much, and weaken and diminiſh it according to their Numbers and Weight.

2. THEY are ſecret Enemies, often taken for Friends, and many Times a Part of our Councils, frequently Men in Office, that have much Power and Influence, and by being in ſuch Departments are able to carry on their Correſpondence with the Enemy, to their great Advantage. This ſhows that ſuch Men are very dangerous, much more ſo than open Enemies. David ſays concerning Ahitophel, If it had been an Enemy I could have born it, neither was it be that hated me, that did
magnify himſelf againſt me; then I would have bid myſelf from him. But it was thou, a Man, mine Equal, my Guide and mine Acquaintance.
Pſal 55 12, 13 Who would have thought a Man of ſo much Wiſdom as Ahitophel, would have joined in ſo bad a Cauſe as Abſalom's? The Counſel that he gave in thoſe Days, was as if a Man had enquired at the Oracle of God. 2 Sam. 16 23 And he was a Profeſſor of Religion. We took ſweet Counſel together, ſays David, and walked unto the Houſe of God in Company
Pſal. 55 14. And this is frequently the Caſe with Tories, that they are Men of Senſe, reputed for Wiſdom, and ſome of them for Religion; but they have broken the Covenant, and employ their Wiſdom to build up and ſupport an unjuſt and wicked Cauſe, the Cauſe of Tyranny.

3. TORIES are an internal Enemy, a Peſt and Plague in our own Bowels. It has often, of old, been obſerved, that the Enemy within the Walls was the moſt dangerous. Theſe are like a Diſeaſe at the Heart, and in the Vitals, and what can be more dangerous?

HAD it not been for theſe corrupted Creatures, the Tools of the Tyrant, we may reaſonably think the bloody Conteſt in America had been ended Years before this, to it's laſting Glory: But how long it will be before this vital Diſeaſe be healed, none on this Side Heaven can tell. Our Danger lies in having theſe Vipers in our Boſoms. And they are inceſſant and indefatigable, and yet, alas, leſs Care than ever taken to detect them, and bring them to cond • gn Puniſhment!

4. THESE wicked Men are Eyes to the Enemy, who would grope in the Dark, were it not for Intelligence obtained by them. The Enemy would not know how to plan their Operations, and to ſtrike to Advantage, were it not for ſuch Judaſes. Indeed they are ſo dangerous we can ſcarce conceive how dangerous they be.—The Butt of their Envy is at the Pillars of the Country, and it's ableſt Friends in every Town; theſe are marked in their Counſels for Deſtruction. And whenever theſe Traitors have guided the Enemy to any Part, they led them to the Houſes of thoſe Men they moſt of all envied and to public Stores.

AT other Times they are aſſiduous in their Endeavors to corrupt their Neighbours; to ſtir up and carry on Diviſions in Towns and Societies; and to ſpread fal • e Reports, together with every other Miſchief the old Serpent is capable of inſtigating them to. Surely we need wiſe and faithful Watchmen to be Day and Night on our civil Walls.
WE now proceed,
IV. To make APPLICATION.—And,

1. WE learn that a Tyrant and a Traitor is abandoned of God, a
Friend of Hell, a Companion of Sata • and an Enemy to the human Species. Satan the Chief, the old Tyrant and firſt Traitor, and theſe his Seconds.

2. WE ſee the dreadful, the diſtreſſing Work Sin has made in this World: a fallen World of Mankind have their Hearts filled with the Seeds of every Evil. 'Tis this that has filled the Earth with Violence, Diſorder and Confuſion; Wars, Rapine and Plunder. This has ſet Man againſt Heaven, and Men one againſt another, ſo that in ſome Senſe every Man's Sword is againſt his Fellow.

SIN made Tyrants; and a Tyrant's Heart is full of the Devil, brim full of Hell. Sin is an evil Habit, an evil and envious Temper. St. Paul gives a ſad Account of the State of Nature and Sin, For we, ſays he, were ſometimes fooliſh, diſobedient, deceived, ſerving diverſe Luſts and Pleaſures, living in Malice and Envy, hateful and hating one another.
Tit. 3. 3.

3. WE may ſee the Danger of breaking Covenant and forſaking Religion. All Men have broken the firſt Covenant by the Fall; but God has graciouſly been pleaſed to make a ſecond Covenant, and has appointed a perfect Head and Mediator of it, Jeſus Chriſt the righteous. This Covenant is propoſed and offered to ſinful Man in the Goſpel; and thoſe that forſake it, and break over the Bonds of it, are moſt juſtly leſt of God to turn Traitors and Tyrants. Covenant-breakers are Traitors to God. They betray his Intereſt, Honor and Glory; and ſet up againſt him to ſupport the Devil's Kingdom, which is made up of Tyranny. And the Devil is not only a Tyrant ſeeking the Deſtruction of thoſe that are in Oppoſition to him, as all good People are, but alſo to his own Subjects, who are his Slaves and Vaſſals, that he binds in his Iron Chains, and drags along to cruel Deſtruction.

BUT now how ſurpriſing is it to behold People that are called Chriſtians, having been brought up under God's gracious Covenant, turn Tyrants and Traitors?—And how many Covenant-breakers are there who have not been leſt to turn Traitors againſt their Country, yet are pulling down the Judgments of God upon the Land?—God is very jealous for his holy Covenant, and has a tender regard for his own Glory, the Religion he has inſtituted and ſet up in the World. And his Power and Wrath is againſt all them that forſake him.
Ezra 8. 22. What brought all the Judgments of God upon Iſrael, but their forſaking his Covenant? And when once they had done this, they threw down God's Altars, killed his Prophets, and eſtabliſhed a falſe Religion. Now although we have not killed the Ambaſſadors of Chriſt with the Sword, yet many have forſaken them, and forſaken Prayer in their Houſes, and public Worſhip,
denied the Baptiſm of their Children, turned their Backs on the Lord's Table, denied the Chriſtian Sabbath, the Lawfulneſs of a defenſive War, the Reſurrection of the Body, and the Day of Judgment. Some deny that there ſhould be any civil Government, and maintain that there ſhould not be any Magiſtrate or civil Law, and that no Murderer ſhould be put to Death, and that every Man ſhould do that which is right in his own Eyes. And ſome aſſert that they are perfect, and ſhall never die. And others that all Men every where and in all Ages ſhall be ſaved, that there is no Hell, or future State of Puniſhment for wicked Men, together with many other monſtrous and abſurd Notions and Opinions. Now all theſe in the firſt Place forſook the holy Covenant, and this opened the Door to every wild Imagination and Diſorder. And how can we ſuppoſe any other but that great is the Wrath of the Lord againſt this Land? Who fears? and whoſe Heart trembles for the Ask of God?

4. WE learn the Neceſſity of the Churches ſtrictly adhering to the holy Covenant; and for every Perſon to conſider the infinite Importance of the Covenant. This is a ſolemn Bond to God and one another, to maintain the Religion of Jeſus Chriſt, and perform every civil and ſocial Duty. Take away this Bond and Obligation to our Maker, and we are at looſe Ends, and lie open to every Flatterer, to all Corruption and Iniquity; Corruption and Bribery from Tyrants, and from Satan; to be beguiled by his Wiles, and drawn away to eſpouſe his curſed Cauſe. And what will be the Iſſue? What, but the Ruin of Religion, the Ruin of our Country, yes, and the eternal Ruin of our own precious Souls?

If Men are not ſenſible of Bonds to their Maker, they will not long be ſenſible of any to their fellow Creatures. All Bonds to one another are derived from our Bonds to our Creator. Leave all Covenant out with God, and all we have with Man ſoon comes to nothing. Therefore, ſee the Neceſſity of conſidering the Covenant in every view of it, and in all it's Extenſiveneſs and Glory, both as a Covenant of Grace, providing, giving and promiſing all Grace to ſinful Men, and as a divine Conſtitution giving Law and laying Obligations on the reaſonable Creature, to perform all Duty to God and one another

5. WE learn the Danger of the Love of this World. The Love of Money is the Root of all Evil. 1. Tim. 6, 10. The Love of the World, and the Love of Money is the rare Thing. If any Man love the World, the Love of the Father is not in him. 1. John 3. 15. Some Man for the Love of Money of Honor, will Tell their Country to a Tyrant; and the Love of Money and Honor makes many a Tyrant. And it a Man's Heart is upon his temporal Intereſt, that Man will be where he 〈…〉 moſt, if it 〈◊〉
with a Tyrant. And how will the Servants of Mammon bow and cringe, fawn and flatter for a little of the World? Yea, Men will ſell their Souls for Money. It has been ſtoried of ſome Men, that they have made a League with the Devil, and ſold their Souls to him for Money. The Story is too true with Reſpect to Worldlings; they virtually ſell their Souls, Chriſt and Heaven for the Things of this vain World, betray their Country and neareſt Friends to a Tyrant, for the empty Vanities of a Moment's Auri ſacra fames, ſaid the Heathen Poet, Curſed Love of Money.

6. How neceſſary the Love of God, and Religion reigning in the Heart, to keep Men from the S • a • es of the Devil and wicked Me • ? If a Man loves God with all his Heart, and his Neighbour as himſelf, he will walk by the divine Rule And ſuch among will be kept from the Hour of Temptation that ſhall come on all the World. He ſhall be kept from the Snare of the Fowler.

7. How excellent the Love of our Country and it's deareſt and ſacred Intereſts? The Pſalmiſt ſays, If I forget thee, O Jeruſalem let 〈◊〉 right Hand forget her Cunning. If I do not remember thee, let my Tongue cleave to the Roof of my Mouth; if I prefer not Jeruſalem above my chief Joy.
Pſal. 137. 5, 6.

8. LET every Man, and the People at large ſee then In 〈◊〉 , & that of their Country; to uſe all poſſible Care of and guard againſt them that give Intelligence to the Enemy. Surely it is Time to rouse up, and ſhake off all Slumber and Sloth—to be vigilant and active. The Enemy will avail themſelves of every Advantage by Intelligence, and Additions to their Party. And we know thoſe Things. What can any Man mean now to accumulate his Wealth by the Times? and to be negligent of the public Cauſe? Are we inſenſible of our own imminent Danger? One Hour may level all our Hours, all our Buildings and Comforts of Life with the Duſt. What means a Diſcord among the Friends of America? Has the old Tyrant, the Enemy of the Liberties of Mankind, infuſed his Poiſon into any of your Minds? Have the mean and ſneaking Tories ſecretly and 〈◊〉 been tampering with any of you under diſguiſe? Or how comes it to paſs that you ſhould be ſo inſenſible of the infinite Importance of brotherly Love, Union and Harmony, that you may ſtrengthen one anothers Hands, and encourage one anothers Hearts in the noble Cauſe of your Country? Union is our Safety, Diſcord our Ruin. Look on your own Situation, and look on the Situation of your 〈◊〉 bleeding Country. Methinks I ſee AMERICA; dear America, like a tender Mother bleeding and gro •• ing with ſavage Wounds, and lifting up her dying Hands, while 〈…〉
My Sons,
my dear Sons, where is your Virtue—your Love to your Country—to your Liberties—to you▪ Religion—to your Poſterity! O, has Avarice, curſed Avarice poſſeſſed your Hearts—lulled you to Step—given the Enemy Advantage! Moſt I die—my Virgins and young Men—my tender 〈◊〉 be ſtain by the mercileſs Savage—be caſt out unpitied and fo •• orn! Rouſe, rouſe my Sons—attend to the Cauſe of your Country. 〈…〉 ,— 〈…〉 —ſtrain every Nerve, revenge my Wrongs, drive the Tyrants 〈◊〉 from the Borders of a Land of Liberty and never give over till you have raiſed and 〈…〉 ſhining Throne of ſweet Freedom and dear Liberty. Heaven looks down with impatient Eye, ſtretching out it's almighty Aid, ready to crown the bold and the brave with Triumph, and with the Laurels of eternal Honor.

div.head: POSTSCRIPT.
div.p: SINCE the foregoing diſcourſe, were ſent to the preſs, ſome things remarkable have occurred, that, by the bleſſing of God, may awaken and alarm the country. Particularly the late infernal plot of the infamous Arnold for delivering up our truly worthy General, and the Army and important works at Weſt Point, into the hands of the enemy; whereby they might ſoon open a paſſage from New-York to Albany, and thence to Canada. Here was treaſon, curſed treaſon, and wickedneſs that wants a name, perhaps in hell as well as earth. And altho' heaven has, in a very wonderful way, diſcovered and broke the ſnare, bleſſed be God forever and ever, yet all the miſchievous deſigns connected with the horrid plan are not ended. The late extraordinary movements and exertions of the Northern enemy. The taking, as we hear, of Fort-Ann, Fort William Henry, or Fort George and Fort Edward, burning and plundering the towns and ſettlements in thoſe parts, and on Mohawk river, and killing and captivating the poor inhabitants, together with the deſolations committed at Royalton, were moſt probably concerted in the aforeſaid infernal plot. Surely we cannot now heſitate a moment longer, whether it be not abſolutely neceſſary to awake and look about ourſelves, in good earneſt. We are, eſpecially on theſe long extended frontiers, and through the Grants, in jeopardy every hour. Every thing we hold dear and ſacred, is eminently expoſed to the ravages of a Tyrant's me cenaries and ſavage cut throats! The dagger is at our breaſts, and the tomahawk over our heads! And the ſituation of our whole country and our army is truly alarming.—My dear countrymen, what think you of theſe things?—Shall we after the moſt glorious ſtruggle for our liberties and our all, that ever the world behold, ſink down in a fatal lethargy, let the enemy take ALL, and enſlave me and our children forever? Why ſhould any call his houſes lands, money or proviſions his own, at ſuch a time as this? Is it not high time that every one ſhould be ready to part with all, except for neceſſary ſubſiſtence, for the ſupport of his country's cauſe? Then we ſhould ſoon ſee a very happy turn in our affairs We ſhould have an Army and have i • well furniſhed and ſupported. God has gives us ability▪ And could we uſe our vigorous ex ••• ions for a little time, with a common bleſſing we might reaſonably hope to ſecure our independence and with it every privilege. The Lo • d is a man of war, and he is on the ſide of Liberty, of the juſt rights of mankind▪ Implore his help, and put your truſt in him. And, MAY heaven inſpire every man with a 〈…〉 and intrepidity in this glorious cauſe, and read forth our armies to victory, glory, and renown. AMEN.
